section.title: Netica Interface
section.para: This is an interface to the &netica-link; for working with Bayesian belief networks and influence diagrams.
The package NETICA is case-sensitive, e.g., you would write (netica:GetNodeExpectedUtils_bn ...) when you need to call GetNodeExpectedUtils_bn.
An interface to all public &c-lang; functions is provided. Additionally, some higher level functionality is available (see modules/netica/demo.lisp for sample usage):

listitem.simpara: Call NewNeticaEnviron_ns and InitNetica_bn and print some statistics; initialize netica:*env*.

Show and, optionally, clear (ClearError_ns), the errors of the given severity (ErrorSeverity_ns) and above. You should call this function after every call to a Netica function. Every wrapper function in this list calls it, so you do &not-e; need to call it after a call to a wrapper function.

listitem.para: Convert netica error to a &string-t; containing ErrorCategory_ns ErrorSeverity_ns ErrorNumber_ns ErrorMessage_ns

listitem.simpara: Terminate the netica session. Sets netica:*env* to &nil;.

listitem.para: Print some information about the net: GetNetName_bn GetNetTitle_bn GetNetComment_bn GetNetFileName_bn GetNetNodes_bn

listitem.simpara: Call NewNode_bn with the given name and many other parameters.
Print some information about the node, preceded by the header.
Call EnterFinding_bn using NodeNamed_bn and StateNamed_bn.
Call NewStreamFile_ns, execute &body-r;, then DeleteStream_ns - just like &with-open-stream;.
The log &stream-t; or &nil;; the default value for the &verbose-k; argument (initially set to &nil;).
